commit_list.message: Better calculations for the ATTACK() action. No longer based on random
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Fleets are now free but if you want them to run you need to upgrade the runtime to at least 1 minute. UPGRADE_SHIP() is now UPGRADE() and to refuel you shouldnt use UPGRADE(), instead use REFUEL_SHIP(ship_id). Games now end after whatever the ROUND_LENGTH is (default 7 days), after that all ships are deleted, fleet runtime reset to 0, events deleted, trades stopped and player balance and fuel reset. Trophies were added and are given out at the end of each round. The tables trophy and item are now both insertable by players. Feel free to add your own items and trophies! Also note, when a round ends you keep your planets ;)
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Bug in move fixed. Tic.pl now run in a screen session rather than a cron job. ref.pl added to monitor how long queries are running for and cancel any over a minute
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: 0.9.2 The return of Move
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: MOVE() fixed to be more space-like. Speeding up and slowing down requires fuel but there is no added cost for distance. my_ships.max_fuel changed to make more sense. my_events.event_id is now my_events.id.
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Tic will no longer fail completely if a fleet_script_#() fails. Also, if the fleet script fails, the player will be notified over their error_channel. Other fixes here and there also included
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Huge changes to event and error system. Errors now never logged, only pushed to a players error_channel. Use LISTEN <error_channel>; to have errors piped to your session on each transaction. Changes to the MOVE system also included (thanks to Tigereye for the code). Other changes to gameplay including how planets work also started.
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: A couple more fixes for the ability to destroy ships. All ship scripts now also generated with a variable 'this_ship_id' to make mass updating scripts easier
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Fixed delete_trade_item() trigger (same bug) and added rule to trade_items so insert can be performed on trade_items instead of trade_item
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Table stat_log and view current_stats added. Tic.pl will update the stat_log table every 60 tics (~60 minutes)
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Added read flag to my_events and my_error_log views (and error_log and event_patron tables). READ_EVENT(event_id) and READ_ERROR(error_id) function also created
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Bug fixes and optimization. Key changes are to MOVE() which now accepts a NULL direction for autopilot, health_percentage added to ships_in_range, and tic.pl now properly runs ship_script_#() functions for all ships. tic.pl was also changed to limit the number of connections that need to be made to the database during each execution
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Added destination_x and destination_y to ship_control. Once these cooridnates are within range, the ships speed (ship_control.speed) will change to 0 to prevent further movement. Fixed a problem in tic.pl that spammed error messages if the ship_script_#() did not work. Fixed the detault ship_script_#() so it doesn't throw errors each time it is run.
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: added a convert_resource() function to allow players to convert fuel to money and back again. The value of the trade is dependant on the balance and fuel_reserve of the schemaverse user

commit_list.message: Resolved many issues in the trading system. Added a rule to the my_fleets view for updating (and removed grant of update to the fleet table). Cleaned up some other rules so that insert,update and delete is all done from the view rather then switching back and forth from view and table (ie:You now insert to my_ships rather then insert to ship and update from my_ships). Also added a new view for online_players.
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Added the Schemaverse Output Stream (SOS) client. Use this to easily receive notify messages from the schemaverse system.
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Everyone now sees all planets in the universe, the goal of the game is to conquer the most by mining. script and script_declarations are now in my_fleets. Adding a new fleet now costs money. Ships can be created anywhere where x and y is between -3000 and 3000 OR it can be created at the same location as a planet where you current hold the conqueror position. Fixed Attack and Defense. All ship skills are now capped (see the variables view). Likely some other changes I will notice once looking at the commit
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Resolved issue with planet discovery where the discovery of the same planet by different users would cuase the tic to fail.
commit_list.repo_description: The Schemaverse is a space-based strategy game implemented entirely within a PostgreSQL database.  Compete against other players using raw SQL commands to command your fleet. Or, if your  PL/pgSQL-foo is strong, wield it to write AI and have your fleet command itself!

commit_list.message: Added some item examples. Feel free to write up new items and add them to the game
